client_id.description: The ID of the Frontegg workspace to operate on.

email.description: The email of the Frontegg user to authenticate as.

password.description: The password of the Frontegg user to authenticate as.

category_id.description: The identifier of the category to which this permission belongs.

created_at.description: The timestamp at which the permission was created.

description.description: A human-readable description of the permission.

key.description: A human-readable identifier for the permission.

name.description: A human-readable name for the permission.

created_at.description: The timestamp at which the permission category was created.

description.description: A human-readable description of the permission category.

name.description: A human-readable name for the permission category.

created_at.description: The timestamp at which the role was created.

default.description: Whether the role should be applied to new users by default.

description.description: A human-readable description of the role.

key.description: A human-readable identifier for the role.

level.description: The level of the role in the role hierarchy.

name.description: A human-readable name for the role.

permission_ids.description: The IDs of the permissions that the role confers to its members.

tenant_id.description: The ID of the tenant that owns the role.

vendor_id.description: The ID of the vendor that owns the role.

created_at.description: The timestamp at which the webhook was created.

description.description: A human-readable description of the webhook.

events.description: The names of the events to subscribe to.

name.description: A human-readable name for the webhook.

secret.description: A secret to include with the event.

tenant_id.description: The ID of the tenant that owns the webhook.

url.description: The URL to send events to.

vendor_id.description: The ID of the vendor that owns the webhook.

allowed_origins.description:
The origins that are allowed to access the workspace.

    This parameter controls the value of the "Origin" header for API responses.

backend_stack.description: The backend stack of the application associated with the workspace.

country.description: The country associated with the workspace.

custom_domain.description:
A custom domain at which Frontegg services will be reachable.

    You must configure a CNAME record for this domain that points to
    "ssl.frontegg.com" before setting this field.

frontegg_domain.description:
The domain at which the Frontegg API is served for this workspace.

    The domain must end with ".frontegg.com".

frontend_stack.description: The frontend stack of the application associated with the worksapce.

open_saas_installed.description: Whether the application associated with the workspace has OpenSaaS installed.

enable_account_settings.description: Enable access to account settings in the admin portal.

enable_api_tokens.description: Enable access to API tokens in the admin portal.

enable_audit_logs.description: Enable access to audit logs in the admin portal.

enable_personal_api_tokens.description: Enable access to personal API tokens in the admin portal.

enable_privacy.description: Enable access to privacy settings in the admin portal.

enable_profile.description: Enable access to profile settings in the admin portal.

enable_roles.description: Enable access to roles and permissions in the admin portal.

enable_security.description: Enable access to security settings in the admin portal.

enable_sso.description: Enable access to SSO settings in the admin portal.

enable_subscriptions.description: Enable access to subscription settings in the admin portal.

enable_usage.description: Enable access to usage information in the admin portal.

enable_users.description: Enable access to user management in the admin portal.

enable_webhooks.description: Enable access to webhooks in the admin portal.

block.description: Configures the color palette for the admin portal.

allow_signups.description: Whether users are allowed to sign up.

allow_unverified_users.description: Whether unverified users are allowed to log in.

enable_api_tokens.description: Whether users can create API tokens.

enable_roles.description: Whether granular roles and permissions are enabled.

jwt_access_token_expiration.description: The expiration time for the JWT access tokens issued by Frontegg.

jwt_algorithm.description: The algorithm Frontegg uses to sign JWT tokens.

jwt_public_key.description: The public key that Frontegg uses to sign JWT tokens.

jwt_refresh_token_expiration.description: The expiration time for the JWT refresh tokens issued by Frontegg.

same_site_cookie_policy.description:
The SameSite policy to use for Frontegg cookies.

	Must be one of "none", "lax", or "strict".

min_score.description: The minimum CAPTCHA score to accept. Set to 0.0 to accept all scores.

secret_key.description: The reCAPTCHA secret key to use.

site_key.description: The reCAPTCHA site key to use.

block.description: Configures the CAPTCHA policy in the signup form.

client_id.description: The client ID of the Facebook application to authenticate with.

redirect_url.description: The URL to redirect to after a successful authentication.

secret.description: The secret associated with the Facebook application.

client_id.description: The client ID of the GitHub application to authenticate with.

redirect_url.description: The URL to redirect to after a successful authentication.

secret.description: The secret associated with the GitHub application.

client_id.description: The client ID of the Google application to authenticate with.

redirect_url.description: The URL to redirect to after a successful authentication.

secret.description: The secret associated with the Google application.

max_attempts.description: The number of failed attempts after which a user will be locked out.

service_name.description: The service name to display in the authentication app.

block.description: Configures the multi-factor authentication (MFA) via an authentication app.

allow_remember_device.description: Allow users to remember their MFA devices.

device_expiration.description: The number of seconds that MFA devices can be remembered for, if allow_remember_my_device is true.

enforce.description:
Whether to force use of MFA.

	Must be one of "off", "on", or "unless-saml".

client_id.description: The client ID of the Microsoft application to authenticate with.

redirect_url.description: The URL to redirect to after a successful authentication.

secret.description: The secret associated with the Microsoft application.

history.description: The number of historical passwords to prevent users from reusing. Set to zero to disable.

max_length.description: The maximum length of a password.

min_length.description: The minimum length of a password.

min_tests.description: The minimum number of strength tests the password must meet.

from_address.description: The address to use in the "From" header of the email.

from_name.description: The name to use in the "From" header of the email.

html_template.description: The HTML template to use in the email.

redirect_url.description:
The redirect URL to use, if applicable.

    Access this value as "\{\{redirectURL\}\}" in the template.

from_address.description: The address to use in the "From" header of the email.

from_name.description: The name to use in the "From" header of the email.

html_template.description: The HTML template to use in the email.

redirect_url.description:
The redirect URL to use, if applicable.

    Access this value as "\{\{redirectURL\}\}" in the template.

acs_url.description: The ACS URL for the SAML authentication flow.

sp_entity_id.description: The name of the service provider that will be displayed to users.

from_address.description: The address to use in the "From" header of the email.

from_name.description: The name to use in the "From" header of the email.

html_template.description: The HTML template to use in the email.

redirect_url.description:
The redirect URL to use, if applicable.

    Access this value as "\{\{redirectURL\}\}" in the template.

from_address.description: The address to use in the "From" header of the email.

from_name.description: The name to use in the "From" header of the email.

html_template.description: The HTML template to use in the email.

redirect_url.description:
The redirect URL to use, if applicable.

    Access this value as "\{\{redirectURL\}\}" in the template.

block.description:
Workspace configuration.

This is a singleton resource. You must only create one frontegg_workspace resource
per Frontegg provider.

category_id.description: The identifier of the category to which this permission belongs.

created_at.description: The timestamp at which the permission was created.

description.description: A human-readable description of the permission.

key.description: A human-readable identifier for the permission.

name.description: A human-readable name for the permission.
